body:
@CsharpIslife , can you try to re-install your package? 
it seems keras converter was invoked,  not xgboost. it looks there is some python environment issue here.

/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/onnxmltools/convert/main.py in convert_xgboost(*args, **kwargs)
     83     if not utils.keras2onnx_installed():
     84         raise RuntimeError('keras2onnx is not installed. Please install it to use this feature.')

issue.title: Converting multiple inputs XGBClassifier model

repository.name: onnxmltools
repository.description: ONNXMLTools enables conversion of models to ONNX

issue.body:
hi
I'm trying to convert an XGBClassifier with multiple inputs to onnx but getting an error with respect to the number of inputs:
`For operator XGBClassifier (type: XGBClassifier), at most 1 input(s) is(are) supported`
I saw an open issue with respect to XGBoost regressor but it seems inactive https://github.com/onnx/onnxmltools/issues/410 so I'm not sure if it is something I missed.

### Dataset:
[Kaggle credit card fraud data set](https://www.kaggle.com/mlg-ulb/creditcardfraud )

### How to reproduce:
```python
import pandas as pd
import onnxmltools.convert.common.data_types
from numpy import dtype
from xgboost import XGBClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from onnxconverter_common.data_types import FloatTensorType, Int64TensorType
from onnxmltools.convert import convert_xgboost

def dtype_to_onnxType(dt):
    if (dt==dtype('float64')):
        return FloatTensorType((1,1))
    if (dt == dtype('int64')):
        return Int64TensorType((1,1))

# read data
df = pd.read_csv('creditcard.csv')
Y = df['Class']
X = df.drop(['Class'], axis=1)

# split data into train and test sets
seed = 7
test_size = 0.33
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, Y, test_size=test_size, random_state=seed)

# train_model
model = XGBClassifier()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# validate
y_pred = model.predict(X_test)
predictions = [round(value) for value in y_pred]
accuracy = accuracy_score(y_test, predictions)
print("Accuracy: %.2f%%" % (accuracy * 100.0))

# convert
schema= [(key, dtype_to_onnxType(value)) for key, value in X.dtypes.to_dict().items()]
model_onnx = convert_xgboost(
    model, initial_types = schema)

```

### Error

```
RuntimeError: For operator XGBClassifier (type: XGBClassifier), at most 1 input(s) is(are) supported but we got 30 output(s) which are ['Time', 'V1', 'V2', 'V3', 'V4', 'V5', 'V6', 'V7', 'V8', 'V9', 'V10', 'V11', 'V12', 'V13', 'V14', 'V15', 'V16', 'V17', 'V18', 'V19', 'V20', 'V21', 'V22', 'V23', 'V24', 'V25', 'V26', 'V27', 'V28', 'Amount']
```

full stack trace:
```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-0f6a7c8cd6fc> in <module>
     35 
     36 schema= [(key, dtype_to_onnxType(value)) for key, value in X.dtypes.to_dict().items()]
---> 37 model_onnx = convert_xgboost(
     38     model, initial_types = schema)

~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/onnxmltools/convert/main.py in convert_xgboost(*args, **kwargs)
     83 
     84     from .xgboost.convert import convert
---> 85     return convert(*args, **kwargs)
     86 
     87 

~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/onnxmltools/convert/xgboost/convert.py in convert(model, name, initial_types, doc_string, target_opset, targeted_onnx, custom_conversion_functions, custom_shape_calculators)
     44     target_opset = target_opset if target_opset else get_maximum_opset_supported()
     45     topology = parse_xgboost(model, initial_types, target_opset, custom_conversion_functions, custom_shape_calculators)
---> 46     topology.compile()
     47     onnx_model = convert_topology(topology, name, doc_string, target_opset, targeted_onnx)
     48     return onnx_model

~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/onnxconverter_common/topology.py in compile(self)
    676         self._resolve_duplicates()
    677         self._fix_shapes()
--> 678         self._infer_all_types()
    679         self._check_structure()
    680 

~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/onnxconverter_common/topology.py in _infer_all_types(self)
    551                 pass  # in Keras converter, the shape calculator can be optional.
    552             else:
--> 553                 operator.infer_types()
    554 
    555     def _resolve_duplicates(self):

~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/onnxconverter_common/topology.py in infer_types(self)
    105     def infer_types(self):
    106         # Invoke a core inference function
--> 107         get_shape_calculator(self.type)(self)
    108 
    109 

~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/onnxmltools/convert/xgboost/shape_calculators/Classifier.py in calculate_xgboost_classifier_output_shapes(operator)
     16 
     17 def calculate_xgboost_classifier_output_shapes(operator):
---> 18     check_input_and_output_numbers(operator, input_count_range=1, output_count_range=2)
     19     check_input_and_output_types(operator, good_input_types=[FloatTensorType, Int64TensorType])
     20     N = operator.inputs[0].type.shape[0]

~/.local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/onnxconverter_common/utils.py in check_input_and_output_numbers(operator, input_count_range, output_count_range)
    281 
    282     if max_input_count is not None and len(operator.inputs) > max_input_count:
--> 283         raise RuntimeError(
    284             'For operator %s (type: %s), at most %s input(s) is(are) supported but we got %s output(s) which are %s'
    285             % (operator.full_name, operator.type, max_input_count, len(operator.inputs), operator.input_full_names))

RuntimeError: For operator XGBClassifier (type: XGBClassifier), at most 1 input(s) is(are) supported but we got 30 output(s) which are ['Time', 'V1', 'V2', 'V3', 'V4', 'V5', 'V6', 'V7', 'V8', 'V9', 'V10', 'V11', 'V12', 'V13', 'V14', 'V15', 'V16', 'V17', 'V18', 'V19', 'V20', 'V21', 'V22', 'V23', 'V24', 'V25', 'V26', 'V27', 'V28', 'Amount']
```

Thanks for the help!
